auditRuleSet.name: CodePro Core
auditRuleSet.description: CodePro's recommended starting point for an audit rule set.

auditRuleSet.name: Effective Java
auditRuleSet.description: Audits from the book 'Effective Java' by Joshua Bloch. These best practices from the book cover areas like coding style, exception usage, Javadoc conventions, naming, possible errors, and threading.

auditRuleSet.name: Internal API
auditRuleSet.description: Audits to look for usage of internal APIs. This mostly occurs in Eclipse RCP development.

auditRuleSet.name: Potential Errors and Refactorings
auditRuleSet.description: Audits to check for errors and code patterns which are commonly problematic.

auditRuleSet.name: Security
auditRuleSet.description: Various security related rules for general Java code and specific JEE libraries.

auditRuleSet.name: The Elements of Java Style
auditRuleSet.description: Audits from the book 'The Elements of Java Style'. These include audits related to formatting, naming, documentation, programming, and packaging conventions.
